[[Colchester]], England
United Kingdom | death_date = | instrument = Vocals, guitar | genre = [[Blues]], [[blues rock]], Rock, [[country blues]], [[gospel music|gospel]], [[African blues]] | occupation = Musician, songwriter, record producer | years_active = 1990–present | label = Dixiefrog Records, Black and Tan Records | associated_acts = Coconut Revolution, NuBlues, West African Blues Project & [[Desert Rock (Band)]] | website = [http://www.ramongoose.com Ramon Goose.com] | notable_instruments = }} '''Ramon Goose''' (born 16 January 1977) is an English [[blues]] guitarist, singer and producer and contemporary [[country blues]] artist, who is known for his work with The West African Blues Project and the [[hip hop]] blues band [[NuBlues]], his mastery of the [[slide guitar]], and for producing other American blues artists' albums. As a solo artist he has toured across Europe and released several albums. ==Biography== Ramon Goose was born in England and started out with British band [[NuBlues]] as guitarist, chief song writer and producer. With Nublues he made the album ''Dreams of a Blues Man'' (released on Dixiefrog Records in Europe, 21st Century Blues Records in the United States, and published by Metisse Music) and has toured all over Europe with the likes of [[Eric Burdon]], The [[Blind Boys of Alabama]], and performed with [[James Brown]]'s bandleader [[Pee Wee Ellis]] and also worked with [[Chris Thomas King]]. After a short stint with American bluesman [[Eric Bibb]]'s band, in 2006, Ramon went on to produce, perform on and co-write critically acclaimed albums for other blues artists. His production for [[Boo Boo Davis]] (Mississippi Blues artist) was voted top ten Blues album in ''[[MOJO magazine]]''s poll in 2006 and his production of Billy Jones (based in Arkansas) ---both on the Black and Tan Records label—also received accolades from critics. Recent projects have included a new album with [[Senegalese music]] star Diabel Cissokho,[http://www.southbankcentre.co.uk/find/music/gigs-contemporary/tickets/diabel-cissokho-ramon-goose-56974 Diabel Cissokho and Ramon Goose] southbankcentre.co.uk. Retrieved March 2011 and production of the second nublues album ''Snow on the Tracks;''. Ramon ended 2009 with a tour with his own band which included four performances at maximum security prisons to test out his new material, which he released in 2011 (Uptown Blues album).{{update after|2011|12|31}} He has continued to tour as well with his new world music/blues band with Diabel Cissokho as well as performing with other artists such as Daby Touré (from Mauritania), Noumoucounda Cissoko (from Senegal), [[Atongo Zimba]] (from Ghana) & Algerian [[Oud]] virtuoso Yazid Fentazi and English/Urdu singer [[Najma Akhtar]]. In 2010 Ramon formed a side project called '''The West African Blues Project''' and further explores the link between Blues and Africa (a track of this project is featured on Rough Guide to [[African blues]] (World Music Network). In summer of 2011 Ramon met musician Jim Palmer backstage at WOMAD festival where Palmer had been performing with [[Baaba Maal]]. Joining with Modou Toure, Goose & Palmer formed the band [[Coconut Revolution (band)|Coconut Revolution]], an album is expected in early 2013 from Coconut Revolution. As of 2012 Goose has started work on the [[Desert Rock (band)]] a unique musical project which evolved after Goose travelled to the Sahara and also [[Dakar]] to combine his love of [[Berber music|Berber]] and [[Mandinka people|Mandinka]] rhythms and melodies with Blues Rock. ==Band lineup== {| class="toccolours" border=1 cellpadding=2 cellspacing=0 style="float: width: 265px; margin: 0 0 1em 1em; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px solid #E2E2E2;" |- ! bgcolor="#E7EBEE" | Ramon Goose & Desert Rock | *Ramon Goose – Lead guitar, vocals *Joe Goose – Bass Guitar *Eric Ford – Drums |- |} ==Discography== [[File:Ramon Goose.jpg|thumb|190px|right|Goose playing slide guitar on a [[resonator guitar]], 2006, Germany. Courtesy: Christian Sahm]] ===Solo=== *''Ramon Goose – Journey into The Blues'' (2008) Tekni Records *''Diabel Cissokho & Ramon Goose – Mansana Blues'' (2010) Dixiefrog Records[http://musicbrainz.org/artist/585f4f10-6f2a-4c20-9a3c-cc0c534880d3.html Ramon Goose] musicbrainz.org. Retrieved March 2011 *''Ramon Goose – Uptown Blues'' (2011) Music Avenue Records ===With NuBlues=== * Nublues – ''Dreams of a Blues Man'' (2004) Dixiefrog/21st Century RecordsMurray, Charles Shaar, [http://observer.guardian.co.uk/omm/reviews/story/0,13875,1219528,00.html NuBlues:Dreams Of A Blues Man] May 2004 The Observer (UK). Retrieved March 2011 * NuBlues – Snow on the Tracks'' (2008) Dixiefrog Records ===Albums Goose has appeared as producer=== * Boo Boo Davis: ''Drew, Mississippi'' (2005) Black and Tan Records * Billy Jones: ''My Hometown'' (2006) Black and Tan Records ===Select special appearances & compilations=== * Various artists: Putumayo Presents African Blues (2012) * Various artists: West African Blues Project appears on Rough Guide To African Blues (3rd Edition) World Music Network (2014) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ramongoose.com official website] * [http://www.myspace.com/ramongoose MySpace page for Ramon Goose] {{Persondata | NAME = Goose, Ramon | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = English [[blues rock]] guitarist, singer and record producer | DATE OF BIRTH = 16 January 1977 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Colchester]], England | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goose, Ramon}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English blues guitarists]] [[Category:English rock guitarists]] [[Category:English songwriters]] [[Category:English record producers]] [[Category:Slide guitarists]] [[Category:Blues rock musicians]] [[Category:Resonator guitarists]] [[Category:Electric blues musicians]] [[Category:People from Colchester]]
